definitions.definition: Already-produced durable goods available for use as a factor of production, such as steam shovels (equipment) and office buildings (structures).
Money and wealth. The means to acquire goods and services, especially in a non-barter system.
definitions.example: He does not have enough capital to start a business.

definitions.definition: A city designated as a legislative seat by the government or some other authority, often the city in which the government is located; otherwise the most important city within a country or a subdivision of it.
definitions.example: The Welsh government claims that Cardiff is Europe’s youngest capital.

definitions.definition: The most important city in the field specified.
The uppermost part of a column.

definitions.example: Interpreters need a good amount of cultural capital in order to function efficiently in the profession.

definitions.definition: (by extension) The chief or most important thing.
Chief, in a political sense, as being the seat of the general government of a state or nation.
definitions.example: London and Paris are capital cities.
One begins a sentence with a capital letter.

definitions.definition: Of or relating to the head.
